channel.title: Hosting a 317
channel.description:
Let me start off by saying, i am new to this! Okay, I've read countless guides on hosting your RSPS online. Ill take you through everything i do.
-I've made my no-ip hostname -I've downloaded DUC 3.0 and checked my no-ip to be hosted -I've Downloaded UTorrent, and changed the Port to "43594" -I've got a source and a client (I can run my server offline, ive changed out all the JDK to my version)
Okay, Now where i run into my problem is trying to login to my server on the client, i always get error conecting to server. I think my problem lies somewhere in the source. Do i have to change anything within the source to enable it to work. Is there a "set" ip in the source that i need to change to mine. I realize there could be many problems here i know im just doing something small wrong. Post any suggestions and i will get back to you if i have done this or not.
Also, if you know just a simple source and client that i could download and you could walk me through it using that one that would be fine. Thanks.

item.title: Hosting a 317
item.dc:creator: @RDogSilly RDogSilly
item.description:
@RDogSilly wrote:

Darkmagic42:

i beleive u just use the default 1, i currently cant check which as as i am not at home.

I’ve got it. Its let me log on with both the no-ip address and the local one. Thanks bunches mate.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Darkmagic42 Darkmagic42

@Darkmagic42 wrote:

i beleive u just use the default 1, i currently cant check which as as i am not at home.

item.title: Hosting a 317
item.dc:creator: @RDogSilly RDogSilly
item.description:
@RDogSilly wrote:

I see, now it asks what ports i’ll be adding and there is TCP and UDP… these are…?

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting a 317
item.dc:creator: @Darkmagic42 Darkmagic42
item.description:
@Darkmagic42 wrote:

thats because you dont put your no-ip adress into ur router while port forwading. put your comp ip adress. To find this go to whatismyip.org

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting a 317
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

Please if you just read my posts you would have it figured out.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting a 317
item.dc:creator: @RDogSilly RDogSilly
item.description:
@RDogSilly wrote:

Darkmagic42:

just look up on google how to port forward your router.

If you wouldnt mind, Could you google “port forward cradlepoint mbr1000” and click on the first choice. Where i run into my problem is in the IP Address Column. You put the Ip you want it forwarded to, but you cant fit the whole “-------.no-ip.biz”

Your post wasnt ignored, The next guy said you should also be able to connect through your own no-ip so i dissregarded, should i not also be able to connect through my own no-ip?

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting a 317
item.dc:creator: @poop_on_u234 poop on u234
item.description:
@poop_on_u234 wrote:

you just have to have2 versions of client

1 with your 127.0.0.1 local host as ip
2 with your no-ip

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting a 317
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

You go in through 127.0.0.1 Other people go through your no-ip
YOU GO THROUGH 127.0.0.1 OTHER PEOPLE CONNECT TO YOUR NO-IP ADDRESS JUST RELEASE OR GIVE YOUR CLIENT TO PEOPLE WITH THE IP SET TO YOUR NO-IP, IGNORE MY POST MUCH?
http://lmgtfy.com/?q=how+to+portforward+with+a+router

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting a 317
item.dc:creator: @Darkmagic42 Darkmagic42
item.description:
@Darkmagic42 wrote:

just look up on google how to port forward your router.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting a 317
item.dc:creator: @RDogSilly RDogSilly
item.description:
@RDogSilly wrote:

Darkmagic42:

try port forwading through your router cp. dont bother using that utorrent. And kingmann, he should be able to connect to his no-ip adress also. If he cant nobody can…

I tried the 127.0.0.1 and that did let me in. But now other people still cant get it (i guess). I will try portforwarding i didnt quite understand it at first so naturally i went with the way that seemed easier, but i can figure it out. Should i just go to portforward.com?

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting a 317
item.dc:creator: @Darkmagic42 Darkmagic42
item.description:
@Darkmagic42 wrote:

try port forwading through your router cp. dont bother using that utorrent. And kingmann, he should be able to connect to his no-ip adress also. If he cant nobody can…

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting a 317
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

No, you connect to 127.0.0.1, other players connect to your no-ip, what you do is release your client with the ip set to your no-ip

Read full topic
